name: Recognition & Biometrics
description: Sector template for recognition and biometric patents including facial recognition, fingerprint scanning, iris recognition, and object detection.
contextDescription: Recognition and biometrics patents cover identification and authentication technologies. Key areas include facial recognition (2D and 3D), fingerprint sensing (capacitive, optical, ultrasonic), iris recognition, gesture recognition, and object detection. High-value applications include smartphone unlock (Face ID, fingerprint), access control, surveillance, and automotive (driver monitoring). This is a sensitive area with privacy regulations affecting deployment.
scoringGuidance: Face unlock patents read on billions of smartphones globally.
Under-display fingerprint sensing is a rapidly growing technology in premium phones.
3D facial recognition (depth-based) has higher security and licensing value than 2D.
Driver monitoring systems (DMS) are becoming mandatory in vehicles - growing market.
Consider privacy regulation impact on deployment but not on patent value.

questions.question: What biometric modality does this patent address? Score: 1-3 for niche modalities, 4-6 for single mainstream modality, 7-10 for face/fingerprint (high-volume) or multi-modal systems.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the biometric type (face, fingerprint, iris, voice, gesture) and market volume.

questions.question: How relevant is this patent to smartphone biometric unlock (Face ID, fingerprint)? This is the highest-volume biometric application.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Smartphone unlock patents have enormous volume. Assess applicability to Apple/Android implementations.

questions.question: Does this patent address security aspects like liveness detection, anti-spoofing, or attack resistance? These are premium security features.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Anti-spoofing and liveness detection are required for secure biometric systems.

questions.question: Does this patent improve recognition accuracy, speed, or reduce false accept/reject rates? These are key performance metrics.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Accuracy improvements are critical for user experience and security certification.
